channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Rookie’s Secret Weapon for Creating Cash Flow in ANY Real Estate Market
item.description: Anyone can get into real estate investing. Seriously, anyone! With today’s high interest rates, it may be more difficult to find a rental property that cash flows, but even if […]

item.title: Palo Alto Networks CEO apologizes for happy hour display featuring women with lampshades on their heads
item.description: Cybersecurity giant Palo Alto Networks is getting a lot of grief for a recent trade show event in which two women posed with lampshades on their heads. The debacle — which unflatteringly recalls the CES booth babes of the early ’90s and 2000s — reportedly happened at a happy hour hosted by CyberRisk Collaborative and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: Early Symptoms and Signs of Psoriatic Arthritis
item.description: Psoriatic arthritis can occur in up to one-third of individuals with psoriasis. Discover the early signs of this chronic inflammatory arthritis.

item.title: How to Retire Early with Fewer Rental Properties Than You Think
item.description: You want to retire early, so you come up with a plan. “I’m going to buy ten rental properties and call it quits, then I’ll never have to work again.” […]

item.title: This Week in AI: AI isn’t world-ending — but it’s still plenty harmful
item.description: Hiya, folks, welcome to TechCrunch’s regular AI newsletter. This week in AI, a new study shows that generative AI really isn’t all that harmful — at least not in the apocalyptic sense. In a paper submitted to the Association for Computational Linguistics’ annual conference, researchers from the University of Bath and University of Darmstadt argue […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.

item.title: Camera app Halide’s latest update adds an option for ‘zero-AI’ image processing
item.description: Popular iOS pro photography app Halide launched its new version today with a new feature called Process Zero, which does not use AI in image processing. Lux Optics, the company behind the Halide app, believes that this option can be a creative tool for photographers to take different kinds of snaps. The company previously allowed […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ‘Deliberate Indifference’: Court Rulings Challenge Extreme Heat Conditions in Prisons
item.description: “If it’s 103 outside, it may be 107 to -8 inside of your cell,” said a man who worked in the fields while imprisoned in Texas.

item.title: Definity raises $4.5M as it looks to transform data application observability
item.description: Definity focuses on the data transformation plane on top of a data lake or warehouse, not the data ingestion part of the pipeline. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Demand For Section 8 Housing Will Remain High—Here’s Why
item.description: Many Americans struggle to afford housing and will continue to, making this one of the most surefire ways to keep your properties in demand.

item.title: Databricks reportedly paid $2 billion in Tabular acquisition
item.description: Analytics and AI giant Databricks reportedly paid nearly $2 billion when it acquired Tabular in June, a startup that was only doing $1 million in annual recurring revenue, according to Bloomberg. That’s a pretty outrageous exit multiple, and it was purportedly fueled by a battle between Databricks and Snowflake. Tabular had over $30 million in […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.
